# This file tells Git about engine files that never really belong in source control. They are usually build products, log
# files and intermediate files generated from a compiler or the engine runtime.

# Compiled Object files, Precompiled Headers, Compiled Dynamic/Static libraries, and Executables
*.slo
*.lo
*.o
*.obj
*.gch
*.pch
*.so
*.dylib
*.pdb
*.mod
*.lai
*.la
*.a
*.exe
*.out
*.app
*.ipa

# Project files that can be generated by the engine
*.xcodeproj
*.xcworkspace
*.sln
*.suo
*.opensdf
*.sdf
*.VC.db
*.VC.opendb

# Built-in UE5 folders that can be regenerated
/Saved/
/Intermediate/
/Build/
/DerivedDataCache/
/StagedBuilds/
/Packaging/

# Log files, Crash reports, and Editor specific files
*.log
*.txt
*.html
*.xml
*.json
*.csv
*.ini
*.crash
*.dmp
.vs/
.vscode/
.idea/
*.user
*.users
*.suo
*.VC.db
*.VC.opendb
*.opensdf
*.sdf

# Mac OS files
.DS_Store

/Intermediate/
/Saved/
/Binaries/
/DerivedDataCache/
/Build/

# Ensure content files (uasset, umap) are tracked by Git LFS (Git Large File Storage)
# This requires having Git LFS installed and configured for these file types in a separate .gitattributes file
